1.speaker: SASAKO
1.japanese: はい…　はい…　ええ　ええ…　ですから…　はい…
1.english: Yes... Yes. Okay. Okay, but... Yes.

2.speaker: POLAR BEAR
2.japanese: わかった　先に入ってる

3.speaker: PANDA
3.japanese: 笹子さん　なんって？

4.speaker: POLAR BEAR
4.japanese: 海が　きれいだって
4.english: She said the ocean is very pretty.

5.speaker: PANDA
5.japanese: なんで　海にいるの？
5.english: Why is she at the ocean?

6.speaker: POLAR BEAR
6.japanese: 久しぶりに電車に乗ったから　方向間違えたって
6.english: She said she hasn't taken the train in a while and got on the wrong one.

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: ペンギンさんも遅いね

8.speaker: POLAR BEAR
8.japanese: また　逃げ回ってるんじゃないの？ ペン子さんズから
8.english: He's probably running away from the Miss Penkos again.

9.speaker: PANDA
9.japanese: ７人もいるから　名前を覚えるだけで 大変だね
9.english: It's hard to even remember all of their names since there are seven of them.

17.speaker: POLAR BEAR
17.japanese: コウテイペンギンのヒナって 本当に　かわいいよね
17.english: Baby emperor penguins are so cute.

18.speaker: KING
18.japanese: あら　アンタも来てたの？

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: ペンギンさんのお友達？
22.english: Is this a friend of yours, Mr. Penguin?

24.speaker: KING
24.japanese: コウテイペンギンなんかと 仲間にしないでよ！
24.english: Don't compare me to the likes of an emperor penguin!

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.japanese: それはこっちのセリフだよ！

26.speaker: BOTH
26.english: Huh? You're not both emperor penguins?

28.speaker: PENGUINS
28.japanese: 僕が　正真正銘のコウテイペンギン！
28.english: I am the true emperor penguin!

29.speaker: KING
29.japanese: 私が　正真正銘のキングペンギン！
29.english: I am the true king penguin!

30.speaker: KING
30.japanese: こんな図体がでかいだけのヤツと 一緒にしないでちょうだい！
30.english: Don't compare me to something with such an oversized head! Ow!

31.speaker: PENGUIN
31.japanese: イタッ！　こっちこそ 一緒にされたくないね
31.english: I'm the one that doesn't want to be compared with {\i1}you{\i0},

32.speaker: PENGUIN
32.japanese: ド派手なオレンジ色の キングペンギンなんかと
32.english: with your flashy orange king penguin color!

33.speaker: KING
33.japanese: ド派手じゃなくて　エレガント！！

34.speaker: POLAR BEAR
34.english: It appears they don't get along.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: 僕らは　平和主義なのに
35.english: We're peace-loving, but the king penguins are always picking fights with us.

36.speaker: KING
36.japanese: 原因はアンタたちでしょ

37.speaker: KING
37.japanese: コウテイペンギンのせいで　私たちはいっつも大迷惑しているんだから
37.english: You emperor penguins are always causing us so much trouble!

40.speaker: KING
40.japanese: 動物園じゃ　キングペンギンのほうが 大活躍しているのに
40.english: King penguins work so much harder at the zoo,

41.speaker: KING
41.japanese: 人間たちは 平気で間違うのよ！
41.english: but humans are always confusing us with emperor penguins!

43.speaker: PANDA
43.japanese: ペンギンにも　いろいろあるんだね
43.english: I guess there's a lot that penguins go through.

44.speaker: PENGUIN
44.japanese: まあ　大人同士は 多少　似てるかもしれないけど
44.english: Well, the adults may look somewhat alike,

45.speaker: PENGUIN
45.japanese: キングペンギンのヒナときたら
45.english: but the baby king penguins resemble dirty mops. How rude!

46.japanese: イタッ！　乱暴しないでよ！！

48.speaker: KING
48.japanese: 家の息子よ かわいいでしょ？
48.english: He's my son. Isn't he cute?

50.speaker: PANDA
50.japanese: ちょっと　怖いかも

51.speaker: KING
51.japanese: 失礼ね！　こういうのが ブスかわいいっていうのよ！！
51.english: How rude! It's called adorably ugly!

52.speaker: PENGUIN
52.japanese: ぼ…　僕… モップとか言って　ごめんね
52.english: H-Hey there... Sorry I compared you to a mop.

57.speaker: PANDA
57.japanese: こっちは 仲よくなってるよ
57.english: They seem to be getting along.

58.speaker: POLAR BEAR
58.japanese: そっちも仲よくしたら？
58.english: How about you two get along, too?

59.speaker: PENGUIN
59.japanese: ま…　まあ 僕は　もともと　平和主義だし…
59.english: W-Well, I am a pacifist at heart.

60.speaker: KING
60.japanese: しかたないわね 特別に停戦してあげるわ
60.english: Oh, fine. Just this once, I'll call a truce. Thank goodness.

61.speaker: POLAR BEAR
61.japanese: 南極平和条約　締結だね
61.english: The South Pole peace treaty has been enacted.

62.speaker: GUY
62.japanese: おっ　コウテイペンギンだぞ
62.english: Oh, hey, it's an emperor penguin. Wow, it is! Wow! Pool! Pool!

63.speaker: NEPHEW
63.japanese: 僕でも余裕の広さだね

64.speaker: POLAR BEAR
64.japanese: 僕でも余裕の広さだね
64.english: It's big enough even for me. Pool! I've gained weight lately with all my drinking, so I'd better swim a lot today. There you are, Mr. Penguin!

65.speaker: PENKOS
65.japanese: ペンギンさん　ひどい！ どうして私を誘ってくれないの？
65.english: Mr. Penguin, how could you? Why didn't you invite me?

66.speaker: POLAR BEAR
66.japanese: さて　ここで問題です

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.japanese: ペンジョリーナさんは 右から何番目でしょう？
67.english: What number from the right is Miss Penjolina?

70.speaker: PENKO
70.japanese: けさ　スマホで つぶやいてたでしょ？
70.english: You announced it with your smartphone this morning.

71.speaker: PENGUIN
71.english: Look after my nephew! He's getting away!

73.speaker: PANDA
73.english: Looks like Mr. Penguin will be able to swim a lot today.

81.speaker: PENJOLINA
81.japanese: 私が　ペンジョリーナ

82.speaker: PENKOS
82.english: I'm Penka. I'm Penna. That's not a stuffed penguin, is it?

84.speaker: KID3
84.japanese: やばいよ！目玉　つつかれるぞ！
84.english: Don't! He'll poke your eyes out!

85.speaker: POLAR BEAR
85.japanese: パンダくん　せっかく プールに来たんだから　泳ごうよ
85.english: Panda! We came to the pool. Come out here and swim!

87.speaker: PANDA
87.japanese: えぇ～？ 僕　涼みに来たんだもん
87.english: What? I just came to cool off.

88.speaker: POLAR BEAR
88.japanese: 食っちゃ寝してたら太るよ
88.english: If you eat then sleep, you'll get fat. You'll get fat!

91.speaker: GIRLS
91.japanese: シロクマさん！ 一緒に遊びましょう！
91.english: Mr. Polar Bear! Let's play together!

92.speaker: POLAR BEAR
92.english: Sure. Yay! Try to get some exercise.

93.speaker: PANDA
93.japanese: はぁ～　極楽　極楽

94.speaker: GUY
94.japanese: あっ　コウテイペンギンだ！

95.speaker: KING
95.japanese: 違うわよ　私は　キングペンギンよ！

96.speaker: GUY
96.japanese: あっ　コウテイペンギンだろ？
96.english: What? But you're an emperor penguin. Jeez! Why do the humans mistake us all the time?!

97.speaker: PANDA
97.japanese: なんで　キングとコウテイなの？
97.english: Why is it king and emperor, anyway? I don't want to talk about it much, but...

99.japanese: 人間が　まだ 南極へ行けなかった頃のことよ
99.english: when humans still couldn't go to the South Pole...

100.speaker: GUY
100.japanese: でかっ！ なんて　でかいペンギンなんだ！
100.english: It's so big! What a big penguin!

101.speaker: GUY
101.japanese: 最大のペンギン　まさに王様　キングペンギンと名づけよう
101.english: The ultimate penguin, the king. Let us name it the king penguin.

102.speaker: KING
102.japanese: 当時　人が見たことのある 一番大きなペンギンはあたしたちだったの
102.english: At the time, the biggest penguins humans saw were us, the king penguins.

103.speaker: PANDA
103.japanese: へぇ～　かっこいい　それで？

104.speaker: KING
104.japanese: その後　人間が南極大陸へ 行けるようになって
104.english: After that, when humans were able to travel to the South Pole... {\i1}Those{\i0} guys just happened to be there. Wow, they're huge!

105.speaker: GUY
105.japanese: あっ　でかっ！　隊長！ キングペンギンより　でかいっすよ！
105.english: These guys are bigger than king penguins, Captain!

106.speaker: GUY
106.english: What should we name them? Well, how about emperor penguin,

107.speaker: GUY2
107.japanese: コウテイペンギンにしちゃえ

108.speaker: PANDA
108.japanese: えっ！？　そんなに簡単に？

109.speaker: KING
109.japanese: 適当なネーミングをしたのは 人間なのに
109.english: Humans made up this name for us, and they still mistake us for emperors.

111.speaker: PANDA
111.japanese: そんなの気にしなくても 大丈夫だよ
111.english: Oh, it's not a big deal.

112.speaker: PANDA
112.japanese: ほら　人生　山あり谷ありって 言うじゃない？
112.english: They say that life is full of mountains and valleys.

114.speaker: PANDA
114.japanese: お腹が空いたら　竹あり笹あり
114.english: When you're hungry, there's bamboo and bamboo grass. You piss me off!

115.speaker: KING
115.japanese: なんか　アンタ　ムカつくのよ！
115.english: You totally piss me off! Stop! Piss me off!

119.speaker: GIRL
119.japanese: あっ　ペンギンさん！

120.speaker: GIRL2
120.japanese: ペンギンさんも運動してる！

124.speaker: KING
124.japanese: 人気ナンバーワンのパンダに 私の気持なんか　わかんないわ！
124.english: You're the most popular of all! You would never understand how I feel!

127.speaker: ADELIE
127.japanese: 南極の恋人 アデリーペンギンです
127.english: I'm the lover of the South Pole, Adélie penguin.

128.speaker: CHINSTRAP
128.japanese: 渋めで地味め アゴヒモペンギンです
128.english: I'm stoic and modest, Chinstrap penguin.

129.speaker: GENTOO
129.japanese: オシャレな性格美人 ジェンツーペンギンです
129.english: I have a stylish personality, Gentoo penguin.

130.speaker: THREE
130.japanese: ３羽合わせて　ピゴセリス属！
130.english: The three of us make upthe Pygoscelis genus!

131.speaker: ADELIE
131.english: We totally pulled that off. Totally.

133.speaker: KING
133.english: Pygoscelis! Your genus is too hard to say!

134.speaker: ADELIE
134.japanese: お久しぶりです　キングペンギンさん
134.english: It's been a while, Miss King Penguin!

135.speaker: CHINSTRAP
135.japanese: キングペンギンさんのアプテノディテス属のほうが 呼びにくいです
135.english: Your Aptenodytes genus is much harder to say.

136.speaker: GENTOO
136.japanese: 同じく　アプテノディテス属の コウテイペンギンさんとは仲よくしてますか？
136.english: Are you getting along with the emperor penguin, who is also from the Aptenodytes genus?

137.speaker: KING
137.japanese: フン！　アイツのまぎらわしい名前で 迷惑しているわ
137.english: His misleading name is always causing me trouble. Our names are rather appropriate, too.

139.speaker: ADELIE
139.japanese: 僕ら　アデリーペンギンなんて　探検家の奥さんの名前なんです
139.english: The namesake for us Adélie penguins is the name of an explorer's wife.

140.speaker: ADELIE
140.japanese: だから　オスでも　アデリーちゃん
140.english: So even the males are Adélie.

141.speaker: CHINSTRAP
141.japanese: 私たちは アゴヒモをしてることにされて

142.speaker: CHINSTRAP
142.english: due to our chinstraps... Wow. We Gentoo penguins

143.speaker: GENTOO
143.japanese: 頭の白い模様が ターバンに似てるから
143.english: got our name from the white pattern on our head which looks like a turban.

144.speaker: GENTOO
144.japanese: ポルトガル語で　異教徒を意味する ジェンツーだなんて！
144.english: So they took the Portuguese word for "gentile."

146.speaker: KING
146.japanese: アンタたちも　いろいろ　あんのね…
146.english: Looks like you've been through a lot, too.

147.speaker: ADELIE
147.japanese: どうです？　パンダくん！

148.speaker: ADELIE
148.japanese: 僕たちのこと 覚えてくれました？

156.speaker: ADELIE
156.english: Do you remember which one is which?

157.speaker: CHINSTRAP
157.japanese: なかなか　覚えられませんよね

158.speaker: GENTOO
158.japanese: しかも　ペンギンは 全部で　１８種類もいるんですよ！
158.english: Not to mention there are 18 different types of penguins. What?!

160.speaker: ADELIE
160.japanese: そこで　この…　ペンギンカード！
160.english: That's why we have these penguin cards!

161.speaker: CHINSTRAP
161.japanese: 遊びながら　楽しく覚えられて…

162.speaker: GENTOO
162.japanese: 今なら　特別価格の５００円！
162.english: Currently for the special, low price of 500 yen! Why are you trying to sell that right now?! Trains are so difficult.

163.speaker: SASAKO
163.japanese: 特別快速とか　通勤急行とか いろいろ　ありすぎ
163.english: There're things like limited express trains, and commuter express trains.

164.speaker: SASAKO
164.japanese: バスみたいに　ボタン押したら 止まってくれればいいのに
164.english: Why can't they be like buses and stop when you push a button...

165.speaker: KING
165.japanese: なんで　コウテイが最強カードなのよ！？
165.english: Why is the emperor's card the ultimate card?!

167.speaker: GIRL
167.japanese: シロクマさん！　ほいっと

170.speaker: SASAKO
170.english: I'm going to swim! So good! The parfaits at Polar Bear's Café are awesome! Huh? You're not Mr. Penguin.

173.speaker: MASAKI
173.japanese: シロクマさん… 間違ってはないんすけど
173.english: You're not wrong, Mr. Polar Bear, but...

175.speaker: SASAKO
175.japanese: パンダくんは　いつものでいい？
175.english: Do you want your usual, Panda?

176.speaker: PANDA
176.japanese: うん　コーヒー 今日は　ブラックにする
176.english: Yes, please. Coffee. I'll have it black today.

177.speaker: MASAKI
177.japanese: パンダさん　コーヒーっすか？
177.english: Wow, Mr. Panda. You're getting coffee?

178.speaker: MASAKI
178.english: So stoic. Call me the Panda that knows the difference.

179.speaker: MASAKI
179.japanese: ブラックって　苦くて おいしくなくないっすか？
179.english: Isn't black coffee bitter and not that good?

180.speaker: PANDA
180.japanese: おいしくなくなくないよ
180.english: It's not not that good. It's because I'm the Panda that knows the difference. What? But it's bitter, right?

181.speaker: POLAR BEAR
181.english: Would you like to try some?

182.speaker: PANDA
182.japanese: しろくまカフェのは　おいしいよ
182.english: The coffee at Polar Bear's Café is delicious.

183.speaker: MASAKI
183.japanese: ホントにおいしいじゃん！

185.speaker: MASAKI
185.japanese: めっちゃいい香りだし

186.speaker: MASAKI
186.japanese: こんなコーヒー淹れられるなんて すげぇっすね！
186.english: It's amazing that you can pour a cup of coffee like this!

187.speaker: POLAR BEAR
187.japanese: おいしさの秘密は 焙煎にあるんだよ
187.english: The secret of the deliciousness is in the baisen.

191.speaker: MASAKI
191.japanese: それ　ゲーセンだし！
191.english: That's an arcade {\i1}(ge-sen){\i0}! What the heck is baisen?!

192.speaker: SASAKO
192.japanese: 焙煎って コーヒー豆を煎ることですよ
192.english: Baisen refers to coffee roasting. Coffee roasting?

193.speaker: POLAR BEAR
193.japanese: うちは　達人が焙煎した豆を 仕入れてるから
193.english: The beans we get are roasted by a master.

195.speaker: PANDA
195.japanese: へぇ～　知らなかった

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.japanese: 連れていってあげてもいいよ
197.english: I wouldn't mind taking you. Really?! It's a little far, though.

198.speaker: MASAKI
198.japanese: え…　外国っすか？ ブラジル？　コロンビア？
198.english: Is it overseas? Brazil? Colombia? We're finally here.

201.speaker: MASAKI
201.japanese: めっちゃ　近いじゃないっすか！

202.speaker: POLAR BEAR
202.japanese: うん　だから ちょっとだけ遠い
202.english: Yes, that's why it's only a little far.

204.speaker: SQUIRREL
204.japanese: あら　シロクマさん！

205.speaker: POLAR BEAR
205.japanese: エゾリスママさん 達人に用があるんだけど…
205.english: Mama Red Squirrel, we'd like to see the master.

206.speaker: SQUIRREL
206.japanese: ごめんなさい 今　手が離せないところなのよ
206.english: I'm sorry. He's a little busy right now.

207.speaker: MASAKI
207.english: So the squirrels are the roasters.

208.speaker: POLAR BEAR
208.japanese: パートのママさんたちだよ
208.english: They're just part-time mothers. Oh, is that him?

209.speaker: POLAR BEAR
209.japanese: うん　達人のキノボリカンガルーさん
209.english: Yes. That's the master, Mr. Tree Kangaroo. All right.

211.speaker: POLAR BEAR
211.japanese: キノボリカンガルーさん　このマサキくんが…
211.english: Mr. Tree Kangaroo, Masaki here... I want to be your pupil!

213.speaker: PANDA
213.japanese: 僕も弟子になりたいです！
213.english: I want to be your pupil, too!

216.speaker: SQUIRREL
216.japanese: 焙煎士なんて地味な仕事よ
216.english: Coffee roasting is a pretty boring job.

217.speaker: SQUIRREL
217.japanese: 私たち　パートだけど…

220.speaker: PANDA
220.japanese: じゃあ　やめときます
220.english: Then I don't wanna. You had no intention to be his pupil to begin with.

222.speaker: MASAKI
222.japanese: 今日 しろくまカフェのコーヒーを飲んで
222.english: After having coffee at Polar Bear's Café today,

223.speaker: MASAKI
223.japanese: 俺　生まれて初めて ブラックがおいしいと思ったんです
223.english: it was the first time I ever thought black coffee was good.

224.speaker: MASAKI
224.japanese: あんなおいしいコーヒーを 自分でも作ってみたいんです
224.english: I'd like to make that kind of delicious coffee myself.

225.speaker: SQUIRREL
225.english: It's not possible. Apparently he doesn't take pupils.

230.speaker: TREE
230.japanese: まぁ　しばらく 通ってみればいいさ
230.english: Well, you can stop by for a while.

232.speaker: MASAKI
232.japanese: 達人！　今日から お世話になります　マサキです
232.english: Master! Thank you for accepting me! My name is Masaki!

233.speaker: TREE
233.japanese: あぁ　エゾリスたちに教わるといい
233.english: All right. The Red Squirrels will teach you.

235.speaker: MASAKI
235.japanese: わぁ…　豆が白いっつうか　薄緑？
235.english: The beans look white... or actually, a pale green.

236.speaker: MASAKI
236.english: Are they moldy? This is an unroasted coffee bean.

237.speaker: MASAKI
237.english: Unroasted coffee bean? It turns brown once you roast it.

239.speaker: SQUIRREL
239.japanese: じゃあ　まず 豆のよりわけ方から教えるわね
239.english: First, we'll show you how to separate the beans.

241.speaker: SQUIRREL
241.japanese: コーヒーを焙煎する前に 悪い豆を取り除いておくのよ
241.english: Before we start roasting, we take out the bad beans.

243.speaker: SQUIRREL
243.japanese: 混ざると味が悪くなるのよ
243.english: If you don't take them out, the coffee will taste bad. Wow, that's a lot of work.

244.speaker: SQUIRREL
244.japanese: 悪い豆っていうのは こういう虫が食ってるやつ
244.english: The bad beans are... like these where bugs ate part of them.

246.speaker: SQUIRREL
246.japanese: そういう豆は見逃さないで 絶対取らないとダメよ
246.english: Make sure you don't over look these and get all of them. Yes, ma'am.

247.speaker: SQUIRREL
247.japanese: あ　大きい豆も取って
247.english: Hey! Take out the big ones, too!

248.speaker: MASAKI
248.japanese: 何で？大きいのいいじゃん
248.english: Why? Aren't the big ones good?

249.speaker: SQUIRREL
249.japanese: 大きいと火のとおりに ムラが出るでしょ
249.english: The big beans would cause uneven roasting!

250.speaker: MASAKI
250.english: We're going to go through all of these?

255.speaker: SQUIRREL
255.japanese: もっと　チャッチャと
255.english: Pick up the pace! Yes, ma'am!

256.speaker: SQUIRREL
256.japanese: もっと　リズミカルに

258.speaker: MASAKI
258.japanese: 俺は　キノボリカンガルーさんに 弟子入りしたのに
258.english: I wanted to be Mr. Tree Kangaroo's pupil!

259.speaker: SQUIRREL
259.english: The newbie has no right to complain!

260.speaker: SQUIRREL
260.english: Move your hands, not your mouth!

262.speaker: SQUIRREL
262.japanese: ほら　チャッチャと

263.speaker: SQUIRREL
263.japanese: マサキ　手が止まってる！
263.english: Masaki, your hands aren't moving! They are moving! I wonder how Masaki is doing. Who's that?

265.speaker: PENGUIN
265.japanese: キミが　すすめたブラックコーヒーに 感動したって人でしょ
265.english: The guy who was moved by the black coffee you recommended, right?

267.speaker: PANDA
267.japanese: 僕　ワルだから 過去は　振り返らないの
267.english: I'm a bad guy, so I don't look at my past. Can I get a café mocha?

270.speaker: SQUIRREL
270.japanese: 腹ごなしに　バレーボールやらない
270.english: How about some volleyball to work off that food? Sure.

273.speaker: MASAKI
273.japanese: 何気に　本格的っすね
273.english: It's more realistic than I thought.

274.speaker: SQUIRREL
274.japanese: じゃあ　ゲーム開始よ

276.speaker: SQUIRRELS
276.english: Nice play! Ow! Okay, now I'm serious!

279.speaker: SQUIRRELS
279.english: Yay! Nice play! So, how did things turn out with the Miss Penkos?

280.speaker: PENGUIN
280.japanese: 思い出させないでくれる
280.english: Please don't remind me of that?

281.speaker: PENGUIN
281.japanese: カフェモカ　おかわり
281.english: Can I get another café mocha?

282.speaker: PANDA
282.japanese: ペンギンさんも たまには　ブラック飲めば？
282.english: Why don't you try the black coffee sometime, Mr. Penguin?

283.speaker: PENGUIN
283.japanese: これ以上 苦い思いはしたくないよ
283.english: I don't need anymore bitterness in my life.

284.speaker: POLAR BEAR
284.japanese: はい　ブラック　サービスね
284.english: Here you go, black coffee. It's on the house.

285.speaker: PENGUIN
285.english: It's bitter, right? Oh, Mr. Tree Kangaroo.

287.speaker: SASAKO
287.japanese: いつも　お疲れさまです
287.english: Thank you for all of your hard work.

288.speaker: POLAR BEAR
288.japanese: マサキくん　頑張ってる？
288.english: Is Masaki working hard? Yeah. Well, he seems to have gotten in with the Red Squirrels.

289.speaker: SQUIRRELS
289.japanese: イエーイ　ストレート勝ち！
289.english: Yay! Straight wins! O-One more time!

292.speaker: PENGUIN
292.japanese: まろやかで　あと味　スッキリ
292.english: It's mild with a refreshing finish. Such a mediocre comment.

296.speaker: POLAR BEAR
296.japanese: グルメレポーター失格だね
296.english: You'd fail as a gourmet reporter.

297.speaker: PENGUIN
297.english: Hey, wait a minute. Mr. Penguin, when did you become a gourmet reporter?

300.speaker: PANDA
300.japanese: なってないのに レポーター気取りなの？
300.english: So you aren't a reporter, but you're acting like one?

301.speaker: PANDA
301.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

303.speaker: PANDA
303.japanese: ツリーの上から見ると　ペンギンさんの人間性の小ささがよく見えるね
303.english: We can really see how petty you are from the top of that tree.

304.speaker: PENGUIN
304.japanese: もっと　いろいろ見えるでしょう
304.english: You can see a lot more besides that, can't you?

305.speaker: PANDA
305.japanese: じゃ　ツリーの上からペンギンさんの隠したい現実を見よう
305.english: Then let's view the truth you want to hide from the top of the tree.

306.speaker: PENGUIN
306.japanese: 厳しんな言い方やめて

307.speaker: PENGUIN
307.japanese: 大体ツリー　ツリーって　ここどこ
307.english: And why do you keep saying, "tree"? Where are we?

309.speaker: POLAR BEAR
309.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

310.speaker: POLAR BEAR
310.japanese: ペンギンさん一人でお送りします
310.english: will be presented to you with just Mr. Penguin.

311.speaker: PENGUIN
311.english: We're all going to be there. Enjoy!
